title.rendered: How the UEFA qualification for the Qatar 2022 World Cup is going

content.rendered:
In September another round of qualifiers for the Qatar 2022 World Cup will begin. In this case we will see how is the uefa classification table going. In addition, here you will see how this whole process is handled and which are the teams that will attend the biggest soccer event in the world.

How many teams play in the qualifiers?

The Union of European Football Associations (UEFA) has 55 affiliated teams, but only 13 places available for the World Cup. In this classification for Qatar 2022 the 55 countries have been organized into 10 groups; 5 groups of 5 teams and 5 groups of 6 teams.

Which countries qualify for the Qatar 2022 World Cup?

To determine which selections will occupy the 13 quotas two phases will be played. The first is the “Group Phase”; here it is a dynamic of all against all, that is, the 55 teams will play against all. More explicitly, each team will face their 4 or 5 rivals twice in home and away matches. All this taking into account that the classification of UEFA and other confederations ends in March 2022.

The last day of the group stage will be from 14 – 16 November 2021. After the culmination of this date, the 10 teams that lead the table of each group will have the first 10 places for Qatar; guaranteeing his pass to the world cup.

After this the play-offs are coming which will be played on March 24, 25, 28, 29, 2022. This phase will be played by the 10 countries that have finished second in the classification table; plus two 2020/21 UEFA Nations League group winners. These 12 nations will be organized into 3 play-off routes; at the end, the winners of each route will get the last 3 places for the world championship.

Current UEFA qualification table

The last day (the third) was played in March of this year. For the month of September 2021 they will play the fourth, fifth and sixth day. However, as of today, August 19, the standings are as follows.

groups of 5

Group A

  • Portugal: 7 points
  • Serbia: 7 points
  • Luxembourg: 3 points
  • Republic of Ireland: 0 points
  • Azerbaijan: 0 points

B Group

  • Spain: 7 points
  • Sweden: 6 pts
  • Greece: 2 points
  • Georgia: 1 pts
  • Kosovo: 0 points

Group C

  • Italy: 9 points
  • Switzerland: 6 points
  • Northern Ireland: 1 pts
  • Bulgaria: 1 pts
  • Lithuania: 0 points

Group D

  • France: 7 points
  • Ukraine: 3 pts
  • Finland: 2 points
  • Bosnia-Herzegovina: 1 pts
  • Kazakhstan: 1 pts

Group E

  • Belgium: 7 points
  • Wales: 4 pts
  • Czech Republic: 3 points
  • Belarus: 3 pts
  • Estonia: 0 points

groups of 6

Group F

  • Denmark: 9 pts
  • Austria: 5 points
  • Scotland: 4 pts
  • Israel: 4 pts
  • Faroe Islands: 1 pts
  • Moldova: 1 pts

Group G

  • Holland: 7 pts
  • Turkey: 6 points
  • Norway: 6 points
  • Montenegro: 6 points
  • Latvia: 1 pts
  • Gibraltar: 0 points

Group H

  • Croatia: 6 points
  • Slovakia: 6 pts
  • Russia: 5 pts
  • Slovenia: 4 points
  • Cyprus: 3 pts
  • Malta: 1 pts

Group I

  • England: 9 pts
  • Poland: 7 points
  • Hungary: 6 points
  • Albania: 4 points
  • Andorra: 0 points
  • San Marino: 0 points

Group J

  • Germany: 9 pts
  • Romania: 6 pts
  • Iceland: 6 pts
  • North Macedonia: 3 pts
  • Armenia: 3 points
  • Liechtenstein: 0 points

Illustratively, taking current positions as an example of the UEFA qualification for the Qatar 2022 World Cup, the automatically classified countries would be; Portugal, Spain, Italy, France, Belgium, Denmark, Holland, Montenegro, Croatia, England and Germany. While Serbia, Sweden, Switzerland, Ukraine, Wales, Austria, Turkey, Latvia, Slovakia, Poland and Romania would enter the play-off phase.

There is still a way to go and the days of september they will bring us new results and positions. In particular, we have already begun our search for the best bookmakers to give our winning predictions. The World Cup is getting closer and closer and you can already feel the excitement.
